Pensacola EggFest organizer said the once-weekend event has now turned into more than 20 events throughout the year. (Pensacola Egg Fest) Escambia County Pensacola EggFest donates record $113,500 to local charities by: Christopher Lugo Posted: Feb 14, 2023 / 10:30 AM CST Updated: Feb 14, 2023 / 10:31 AM CST Pensacola EggFest organizer said the once-weekend event has now turned into more than 20 events throughout the year. (Pensacola Egg Fest) by: Christopher Lugo Posted: Feb 14, 2023 / 10:30 AM CST Updated: Feb 14, 2023 / 10:31 AM CST SHARE PENSACOLA, Fla. ( WKRG ) — According to officials with the charity barbecue event Pensacola EggFest, the 2022 event doubled what organizers gave away in 2021, a record $113,500. “There’s a lot of love in our heart for the Pensacola area and for the charities that have been a part of Pensacola EggFest over the last 10 years,” Co-founder Lisa Lyter said. “When we total it all up, Pensacola EggFest has given more than $650,000 dollars to local charities. Those charities are kids who won’t go to bed hungry, kids fighting cancer who will get more research, and families who will feel safer in our communities.” FORECAST: Get the latest local forecast from the WKRG First Alert Storm Team Pensacola charities who are recipients of the 2022 Pensacola EggFest donations include Pensacola’s Finest Foundation, Manna, Rally Pensacola, Studer Community Institute, Hunting for Healing, Escambia County Fire Rescue, Escambia County Sheriff’s Office Foundation and PACE Center for Girls. Co-founder Doug Jolly said the once-weekend event has now turned into more than 20 events throughout the year. “People are really starting to notice what Pensacola EggFest is doing throughout the year as much as our November event,” Jolly said. “Our cook teams mobilize to serve thousands of meals to thousands of deserving people — volunteers working for a local cause, businesses who lost everything in a storm, families in need.” Organizers said the Pensacola EggFest, sponsored by Kia Pensacola, has become a destination event. They said economic impact to Pensacola has been verified at over $200,000 for just the main event. Cook teams, judges and visitors come from Oregon, Tennessee, Texas, Iowa, Alabama, Georgia, Arkansas, North Carolina, South Carolina and Louisiana. READ NEXT: Latest Florida headlines from WKRG.com Co-Founder Jerold Hall said the Pensacola EggFest team feels blessed to be able to put on this charity barbecue party every year. “People ask us why we do Pensacola EggFest and we say, ‘we GET to do this.’” Hall said. “Meaning, we can leverage a hobby we enjoy which benefits those in need. For us it’s simply a love of cooking and the joy of channeling that outpouring back to our communities.” To learn more about Pensacola EggFest visit the Facebook page or click here . Pensacola Eggfest — Pizza-Porta Cart 0 Sign In My Account Shop Recipes FAQ Setup/Fit About Us Blog/Info Sign In My Account Cart 0 Authentic Pizza in your Backyard Shop Recipes FAQ Setup/Fit About Us Blog/Info Pensacola Eggfest 161113 Pensacola EggFest-9 The Pensacola Eggfest marks the 1 year anniversary of the Pizza-Porta product.  I had been tinkering with a way to improve the results of my pizza-making in the egg for some time.  Last year I decided to "go-for-it".  We loaded up three hand-made prototypes and did our first cooking event.  Our test was having 10 people express sincere interest in the product.  If this happened we would take the next step (whatever that might be).  If not, we would enjoy pizza from the units we made and go home and do something else. When we got to the Eggfest, we were showered with attention.  People flocked to the booth asking questions, looking for details, and asking where to purchase. We got the signal we were looking for.  We also had people raving about the great character of the crust and taste of our pizza.  We kept hearing that the pizza was somehow better than their usual Big Green Egg Pizza. This year we returned to the Pensacola Eggfest having cooked a couple hundred pizzas.  We also brought some units to launch Escambia Electric, the Eggfest dealer in Pensacola.  It was a great "homecoming" for us.  Thank you to the organizing committee and all of the volunteers who put this spectacular event together for the community.  We are humbled by the amazing impact that the Pensacola Eggfest has on this community. 161113 Pensacola EggFest-3 161113 Pensacola EggFest-1 Our day was again filled with curious onlookers and eager taste-testers.  We showed people how to stretch dough and how to load pizzas into the oven.  The pizzas again received fantastic feedback.  We earned pizza cred from quite a few skeptical fans who had never had pizza that good out of an egg (or as some said, even at a local pizza joint).  A steady, 650-700F degree oven does wonderful things to good pizza dough.  Thanks to all those who supported us for people's choice with their tips! 161113 Pensacola EggFest-2 161113 Pensacola EggFest-8 We were then honored when we got called down for the award ceremony!  The Pizza-Porta Peelers team was awarded the "Spirit of Eggfest" award.  It was fantastic to be recognized, and we are grateful for the award. And we got to hang out with Big Mo!  I want to thank my ever-dedicated support team for shopping, making the trip, serving, busing, cleaning, and being fantastic friends. Thank You Pensacola Eggfest! 161113 Pensacola EggFest-5 Thank you for reading! Subscribe to our occasional blog. Darien Schaefer President/​CEO Hometown: Milwaukee, Wisconsin Born in Milwaukee, WI and growing up in the resort community of Wisconsin Dells, Darien has been involved in the hospitality and tourism industry for over 40 years. Send An Email Read Bio Hometown: Milwaukee, Wisconsin Born in Milwaukee, WI and growing up in the resort community of Wisconsin Dells, Darien has been involved in the hospitality and tourism industry for over 40 years. A graduate from the University of Wisconsin-Stout with a degree in Hotel/Restaurant Management, Darien has worked for Holiday Inn Corporation, Marriott Hotels, and Tharaldson Lodging. It was with Tharaldson Lodging, as an Area Director responsible for 13 hotels in 8 different markets, that Darien began working closely with destination marketing organizations. Darien eventually left Tharaldson Lodging to become the Executive Director for the Janesville Area Convention & Visitors Bureau in 1998. In April of 2000, Darien joined the Wausau/Central Wisconsin Convention & Visitors Bureau. During his 13 years as the Executive Director, Marathon County rose from 17th to 9th out of 72 counties in Wisconsin for Economic Impact from traveler spending. Darien expanded the role of the CVB by creating a Sports Authority function that was responsible for developing new sporting events. Darien joined the Lake Geneva Chamber of Commerce and Convention & Visitors Bureau in November 2013. Under Darien’s leadership, the two organizations were merged into Visit Lake Geneva in 2016. Darien joined Visit Big Bear in 2017 as President & CEO to promote the resort community of Big Bear Lake, CA. In addition to growing tourism receipts by 83% in three years, Darien directed the purchase and renovation of a 5,000 sq. ft. building for a new Visitor Center and offices. Darien and his wife, Karen, moved to Pensacola in April of 2020 when he accepted the position of President & CEO for Visit Pensacola. Nicole Stacey Vice President of Destination Development Hometown: Fort Walton Beach, Florida Trendsetter. Coffee addict. Travel enthusiast Born and raised on the beaches of Northwest Florida, Nicole has an innate love for the Sunshine State, its pristine beaches, and the thrill of travel. Cultivating over 15 years of marketing and communications expertise, Stacey has over 20 years in the tourism and hospitality industry..... Send An Email Read Bio Born and raised on the beaches of Northwest Florida, Nicole has an innate love for the Sunshine State, its pristine beaches, and the thrill of travel. Cultivating over 15 years of marketing and communications expertise, Stacey has over 20 years in the tourism and hospitality industry. As Visit Pensacola's Vice President of Destination Development, Stacey leads the marketing and sales departments. She is responsible for identifying market opportunities, developing short- and long-term marketing and sales plans and strategies, directing all communications and public relations functions, and ensuring community-wide destination development investments increase and travel-related strategies are connected and aligned. Throughout her career, she has spearheaded numerous successful initiatives, marking significant achievements in the industry. Notable highlights include transforming Visit Pensacola's public relations efforts with out-of-market activations at prestigious events like the Country Music Awards in Nashville, Chicago Air and Water Show, several in-market television productions, and media-related opportunities in New York, Canada, and London, UK. Stacey has played a pivotal role in several multi-rebranding campaigns, including the development of Visit Pensacola's latest brand, "The Way to Beach." Additionally, she has been an integral part of the evolved Tourism Works for Pensacola campaign—an initiative to communicate tourism's invaluable impact in Escambia County. Actively engaging with professional and travel industry associations and dedicated to the Pensacola community, Stacey serves as a Board Member for Destinations Florida and contributes to the Destinations International PR Task Force. Additionally, she is a part of the NWFL Beaches Coalition Brand Team. She has assumed several leadership roles over her tenure, such as Chairing the 2023 Leadership Pensacola Class, being Past President of the University of West Florida Alumni Association, Fiesta Pensacola Board of Governors, Florida Public Relations Assoc past president and state board member, and the Foo Foo Festival Curator to name a few. Recognized as a rising star by InWeekly in 2013 and honored with the 2022 Florida Public Relations Association Communicator of the Year award. Stacey was recently named the 2023 Emerging Leader for the Greater Pensacola Chamber PACE Awards. She takes pride in representing her community worldwide and showcasing Pensacola as a premier travel destination. The proud graduate of her master's degree in strategic communications and leadership and a B.A. in public relations and marketing from the University of West Florida – Go Argos! In her spare time, Nicole finds joy in her role as "Auntie Coco," cherishing moments spent with family and friends, indulging in her community like a local should and booking her next plane ticket to fulfill her love and passion for travel and experiencing new places and cultures around the world. Wandy Samuel Director of Finance and Administration Hometown: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia Numbers guy. Super dad. Wandy entered the tourism industry in 2013 as a staff accountant for Premier Island Management Group... Send An Email Read Bio Wandy entered the tourism industry in 2013 as a staff accountant for Premier Island Management Group before joining the Visit Pensacola team in 2016. Previously, he served as the operations manager for Dollar Rent a Car of which he was responsible for effective and successful management of labor, productivity, quality control, safety measures and standard business operating procedures. He holds a degree in accounting from Pensacola Christian College.Outside of work, he enjoys spending time with his daughter. The two enjoy riding bikes, going shopping and Skyzone. He is an active member of Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida. Kaya Man Director of Sales & Services Hometown: Kailua-Kona, Hawaii Fishin’ chick. Chef. Beach bum Kaya Man joined Visit Pensacola in 2018 as the Partner Relations Manager... Send An Email Read Bio Kaya Man joined Visit Pensacola in 2018 as the Partner Relations Manager. She was responsible for partnership development and maintenance for the organization. In 2021 promoted to Destination Sales Manager, serving as the sales representative to the group and leisure market to generate a positive economic impact for Escambia County. In 2023 promoted to Director of Sales and Service, overseeing all sales efforts in group, trade and leisure markets, partner relations and the visitor centers. She has also taken on the role as the Northwest Florida Beaches Sales Representative to the Council. Kaya brings over 20 years of hospitality experience to the Visit Pensacola team. Man spent the last eight years prior to joining the team, serving, managing, and the head trainer at The Grand Marlin on Pensacola Beach. Previously, she owned an event planning company and Elephant Seasoning, a catering and seasoning business started by her father. She holds a bachelor’s degree in restaurant and hospitality management from the Pensacola Junior College and University of West Florida. Man is actively involved in the community, serving as UWF Women in Leadership Conference hospitality co-chair, Sun Belt Conference Team host committee, Sea Grant Advisory Team, donating time to the Children’s hospital, served as the Greater Pensacola Tennis Ladies League captain for 8 years, and a part owner/ operations manager to Tighten up Tennis. Outside of the office, she enjoys cooking, playing tennis, fishing, traveling, and spending time at the beach with her family. Ashley Hendrickson Administration Assistant Hometown: Pace, FL Book connoisseur. Athletics enthusiast. Bonding aficionado Ashley joined Visit Pensacola in 2023 as the Administration Assistant... Send An Email Read Bio Ashley joined Visit Pensacola in 2023 as the Administration Assistant. She is responsible for coordinating calendars between Darien, Staff and the Board, various office projects, and all things related to board meetings. Bottomline, Ashley will ensure the office runs smoothly and cohesively. She has spent the last seven years in New York City, most recently as the Executive Assistant to the owners of Team Epiphany, a marketing and creative agency. Her strengths include project support, process improvement, relationship development, and strategic communication. A Pensacola native, Ashley is a graduate of The University of West Florida with a bachelor's degree in Organizational Communication and a minor in Hospitality. While she is not in the office, she finds joy in various hobbies such as reading, attending theatre performances, engaging in sports, and relishing the great outdoors. Lana Malaise Staff Accountant Hometown: Pensacola, FL Devoted and passionate Mom. Numbers gal. Concert lover. Lana Malaise joined Visit Pensacola in April of 2024 as the Staff Accountant. She is responsible for assisting the Director of Finance in the processing of all things accounting related to Visit Pensacola. Send An Email Read Bio Prior to joining our team, Lana worked in the private sector as a Bookkeeper and Accounting Manager in various businesses in various locations to include Kentucky, Illinois and Florida. Lana originally moved to Pensacola in 1978 when her family moved here as a duty station of her father’s at USN Saufley Field Base, Pensacola. Upon graduating from UWF in 1988 as one of the school’s first class of freshman in 1983, she began her career in accounting at various local CPA firms. She left the area in 1993 to move to central Kentucky and finally returned ‘home’ to Pensacola/Pace area in 2016 after expanding her family with four beautiful daughters. Lana considers her greatest accomplishment to being a Mom. In her spare time, she enjoys playing tennis, playing cards with her family, and enjoying listening to live music along the Gulf Coast as much as she has time to do. Marketing and Communications Shawn Brown Digital Marketing Manager Hometown: Gulf Breeze, Florida IT Guy. Outdoor Aficionado. Family Guy. As the digital marketing manager, Shawn Brown joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2013... Send An Email Read Bio Shawn Brown joined the Visit Pensacola team as the digital marketing manager in 2013. He is responsible for managing the website, assisting partners with listings and supporting internal team members. He is experienced in search engine optimization, creative design and data analysis. Before Visit Pensacola, Brown served as a webmaster for Cox Communications for 13 years. There, he developed applications for internal communications and focused on web design. After college, he was self-taught in web design, coding, and information technology. Shawn earned a bachelor’s in biblical studies from Calvary Chapel Bible College. A true outdoorsman, Shawn and his wife Lindy own Outdoor Gulf Coast, an adventure equipment rental company. In his spare time, he enjoys windsurfing, paddling, hiking and more. The two have two children, Sarah and Sam. Lindsey Steck Marketing & Communications Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Experience chaser. Content curator. NFL buff Lindsey Steck joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2017 and is responsible for copywriting, writing for press, public relations... Send An Email Read Bio Lindsey Steck joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2017 and is responsible for copywriting, writing for press, public relations, integrated marketing, content curation and social media management. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Steck served as a corporate communications assistant for the Kansas City Chiefs where she served as a public relations contact for community outreach events. She was responsible for writing for press and publication, press conference facilitation, public relations, football communications support, assisting club executives and game day support. Throughout her time in college, she served in athletic communications as the public relations contact for men and women’s cross country and additionally assisted with 13 other sports. Steck began her journey in the tourism industry working for Florida House on Capitol Hill, the country’s only state embassy in Washington, D.C. There, she supported events, assisted administration and welcomed guests from across the globe. She holds a bachelor’s degree in communications with an emphasis in public relations from the University of West Florida. Outside of the office, Steck is actively involved in the community. She currently volunteers with Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida, Junior League of Pensacola and serves on the Board of Directors for the Florida Public Relations Association. In her free time, you can find her scouring farmer’s markets, watching NFL football and working on her East Hill cottage. Elliott Cooper Digital and Creative Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Gamer. Drone Flier. Digital Guy. Elliott Cooper joined Visit Pensacola in 2021 as the Digital & Creative Manager and is responsible for inhouse graphic and video creation... Send An Email Read Bio Elliott Cooper joined Visit Pensacola in 2021 as the Digital & Creative Manager and is responsible for inhouse graphic and video creation. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Elliott worked as a Digital Marketing Coordinator for Innisfree Hotels and Keep Pensacola Beautiful. Raised in Gulf Breeze, Elliott is a true local and spent most of his time growing up on Pensacola Beach. Elliott earned a bachelor's degree in communications from the University of West Florida. Elliott enjoys technology and loves tinkering with electronics and computers in his free time. He has two cats and two dogs and he loves taking the dogs on long walks on the nature trails around UWF. Blake Howerton Social Media & Content Associate Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Pensa-local. Creative being. Old soul. Blake Howerton joined Visit Pensacola in 2022 as the social media and content associate and is responsible for planning... Send An Email Read Bio Blake Howerton joined Visit Pensacola in 2022 as the social media and content associate and is responsible for planning, creating, and implementing social media content across eight platforms. Blake is a Pensacola native. After receiving a bachelor’s degree in communications with a focus in advertising from the University of North Florida in Jacksonville in 2018, Blake moved back home to begin his marketing career. Before joining the Visit Pensacola team, he served as the communications coordinator at Studer Family Entertainment & Retail for 3 years, and as the marketing and communications coordinator at Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida for over a year. Blake has a passion for sharing Pensacola’s story with others. Off the clock, Blake enjoys photography, cooking, watching the sunset on the beach with his friends, and dining at Pensacola’s many restaurants. He is actively involved with Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Florida serving on the Big Gala Committee. Hannah Pinson Website Associate Hometown: Navarre, Florida Sunset Lover. Ocean Enthusiast. Cat Mom. Hannah Pinson joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2023 as the Website Associate. She is responsible for creating and maintaining website content... Send An Email Read Bio Hannah Pinson joined the Visit Pensacola team in 2023 as the Website Associate. She is responsible for creating and maintaining website content, writing email newsletters, creating/editing blog posts, and more. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Pinson worked as an IT recruiter. She earned a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and a minor in Marketing Applications from the University of West Florida. She has experience in software development, digital marketing, public relations, and content creation. Outside of work, she enjoys creating videos and taking photos. She also loves to shop, go to Disney World, hang out with family, and play with her two cats. A proud UWF Alum, Hannah serves on the UWF IT Alumni Advisory Board. Growing up in the Florida panhandle, she has a huge appreciation for the beach and will never pass up an opportunity to catch a good sunset or go for a swim in the Gulf. Sales & Services Melissa Bailey Partner Relations Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Foodie. Optimist. Baseball Mom. Melissa Bailey joins the Visit Pensacola team with over 20 years of industry experience.... Send An Email Read Bio Melissa Bailey joins the Visit Pensacola team with over 20 years of industry experience. For the past 17 years, she has served Great Southern Restaurants as the director of catering and private events. With experience in both the front and back of house operations, she thrives in making connections with community partners and stakeholders. A native of Pensacola — and planning to stay that way by continuing to build roots with friends, family, and loyal customers, she is the perfect person to trust with your business needs. Tia Robbins Destination Sales Manager Hometown: Omaha, Nebraska Visionary. Connector. Boy Mom Tia Robbins joined the Visit Pensacola team as the Destination Sales Manager in February 2023.... Send An Email Read Bio Tia Robbins joined the Visit Pensacola team as the Destination Sales Manager in February 2023. In her role, she is responsible for facilitating leads and inquiries for group sales, attending trade shows, developing relationships with clients promoting Escambia County, and more. Prior to joining Visit Pensacola, Tia began her career in public relations and marketing in the music and entertainment industry in New York City. After relocating to the Pensacola area in 2012 she became deeply committed to, and passionate about serving the Pensacola community. In 2014, Robbins and her husband co-founded Mr. Robbins’ Neighborhood, a 501(c) 3 non-profit organization that serves underserved student athletes in Escambia and Santa Rosa Counties in Florida, by positioning, preparing and developing program participants for success beyond high school sports. In addition to working in the non-profit sector, Tia found a passion in entrepreneurship and supporting small businesses and in 2020 founded, Taste of Pensacola, LLC., a unique online gifting service that partners with local area makers and artisans to feature in a selection of curated and themed gift boxes. In her free time, Robbins enjoys traveling, being a sports mom, and making memories with her husband, Fred and two sons, Tre’ and Troi. Larry Orvis Facilities Manager Hometown: Pensacola, Florida Building gate keeper. Veteran. Bookworm Larry Orvis currently serves as the facilities manager for Visit Pensacola. He is responsible for building maintenance, beautification... Send An Email Read Bio Larry Orvis currently serves as the facilities manager for Visit Pensacola. He is responsible for building maintenance, beautification, and office management. Orvis joined the team in 1998 as a tourism ambassador and served for two years before moving into his current role. Prior to Visit Pensacola, Larry was a member of the U.S. Army for 28 years working in logistics. He retired to Pensacola in 1992 because he enjoys all of the activities. Outside of work, he enjoys reading. Jennifer Saba Sales and Services Associate Hometown : Hattiesburg, MS Boy Supermom. Holiday Extraordinaire. Steel Magnolia. Jennifer joined the team in December of 2024 as the Sales and Services Associate. Jennifer’s role is... Send An Email Read Bio Jennifer joined the team in December of 2024 as the Sales and Services Associate. Jennifer’s role is directly involved with destination sales, partner relations, organizing community tourism events, and more. Prior to joining Visit Pensacola, Jennifer served as the Executive Director of the Pensacola Mardi Gras Foundation, where she created impactful community experiences through PMG events. Before joining Pensacola Mardi Gras, Jennifer served as the Annual Giving Coordinator at the Ascension Sacred Heart Foundation, where she organized Pensacola's largest Mardi Gras Ball, the Cordova Mall Ball, successfully raising funds to benefit the Studer Family Children's Hospital. She also worked closely with Children’s Miracle Network Hospital initiatives, partners, and events. Before moving to Pensacola in 2015, Jennifer worked as a Marketing and Communication Specialist for Spirit of Women, coordinating events, marketing programs, and outreach campaigns. She mentored hundreds of teenage women, leading enrichment programs and creating community service opportunities. She was honored as the 2013 Junior Professional of the Year by the Mississippi Hospital Association’s Society for Health Care Marketing and Public Relations. Jennifer’s career has been centered around what she calls 'fun' work! She worked at Walt Disney World, gaining expertise in Resort Operations at Disney Vacation Club Resorts. She also served as a Program Leader, worked in Convention Services, became a Certified Disney Trainer, and was awarded the 'Cricket of the Quarter' Cast Member Excellence Award, along with numerous 'Great Service Fanatic' awards for outstanding guest service. During her time in Central Florida, Jennifer also worked with the Orlando Magic NBA Team, ensuring a top-tier experience for VIP season ticket holders. Jennifer is passionate about creating memorable experiences, fostering relationships, and having fun while doing so. With a minor in Tourism Management, she is excited to be fully immersed in the world of tourism and help showcase Pensacola. In her free time, Jennifer loves being with her family and embracing all the fun 'boy mom' adventures! Whether it's hanging out with loved ones and friends, enjoying our beautiful beaches, sipping a bushwhacker, traveling, or cheering from the T-ball field, she’s all about embracing the fun and joy life brings! She also treasures simple moments, like staying home, snuggling up, and watching movies with her boys. Visitor Services Debbie Keegan Tourism Ambassador Hometown: Atlanta, Georgia Estate Sale Guru. Entertainment Festivals Lifestyle Food Crush News Pensacola Moe Cason and Pensacola Eggfest Competing at the World Championship BBQ Contest This Week By Lisa Long - May 16, 2024 Moe Cason and team at the World Championship BBQ Cooking Contest at Memphis in May. Doug Jolly, Moe Cason, Lisa Long Lyter, and Jerold Hall at Pensacola Eggfest, 2018. Photo: Camera and Flask Need to chat with someone on the Pensacola Eggfest Team this week?  Well, I’m about the only one in town! Advertisement Because it is the week of the World Championship BBQ Contest at Memphis in May ! While I (and when I say “I”, I mean my husband) am securing the left-behind grills in prep for this coming storm, the grilling team joined our dear friend, Champion Moe Cason on Monday afternoon with our newest trailer in tow. The World Championship Barbecue Cooking Contest (WCBCC) is the largest pork barbecue contest in the world and has been featured on the Food Network. The largest collection of championship-winning teams has arrived at Liberty Park in Midtown Memphis to vie for the coveted title of Memphis in May World Champion, and they lit the grills yesterday for the first time this week. This year, 22 states are represented and four foreign countries.  The teams come prepared to compete in three categories:  whole hog, shoulders, and ribs. Moe Cason, of Moe Cason BBQ, is a familiar face in Pensacola as he has been a celebrity judge at Pensacola Eggfest eight out of the ten years we have thrown our BBQ party each November. In 2013, I read about Moe Cason and his love for BBQ and sent him an unsolicited email explaining that we were planning a BBQ competition fundraiser.  I shared how we had a beautiful condo on the beach for him to vacation in if he would consider joining us.  He replied two days later, “Yes, Lisa.  Call me on Tuesday” and that was the beginning of what we now refer to as the birth of our BBQ family adding to the original crew. This is the 46th edition of this beloved Memphis tradition and the Moe Cason team returns after placing 3 rd in 2023 for shoulders (the field last year was filled with 300+ teams). Moe is a straight champion by himself and is the winner of many championships (competing in over 250) along with starring on Destination America’s “BBQ Pit Masters”, “BBQ Pit Wars”, and “Smoked”.  He has also served as a judge on several Food Network shows. When Moe packs up on Monday after the contest is completed, he will head to New York for his guest appearance on Good Morning America. He will be sharing with ABC’s viewers the stories behind his brand new, just-off-the-press cookbook that went live on May 7 th .   His cookbook is filled with his favorite recipes.  It also offers the easy going, expert guidance he offers freely to those who want to learn how to cook perfectly seasoned collard greens and fall-apart tender Texas brisket.  Want a signed copy?  Stay tuned for details as he will be at Bodacious Bookstore and Cafe on June 22, 2024. The Pensacola Eggfest team is in their 8 th year of assisting Moe in his quest for an additional life-size trophy from the World Championships.  Leading Moe’s team as Captain is Doug Jolly (co-owner of Local Pulse). He is joined this year by Jerold Hall, Luke Gipp, Sean Norenberg, Schyler Sheffield and Kevin Winnegar.   Additionally, Michael Jeffries of the Big Smoke BBQ Company has flown in from New Zealand.  You may recognize the name and the man as he catered the VIP lamb dinner for Pensacola Eggfest this past year and you couldn’t stop talking about how delicious it was!  And Brian and Shelley Gurney of Bad Bones BBQ arrive this evening. There will be many laughs, late nights stoking the fire, a few sips of bourbon here and there, and some professional-level name-calling.  And at the end of it? My prediction is this…..the strongest of brotherhoods known as the Moe Cason BBQ team will be called to the stage to be awarded once again. I am super proud of these guys, my BBQ family, and I don’t tell them enough.  Here is to bringing home the championship and some solid memories! Cheering you on from Pensacola, XO, Lisa TAGS BBQ BBQ Champions BBQ competition Grilling Liberty Pary Midtown Memphis Memphis in May Memphis in May World Championship BBQ Cooking Contest Moe Cason Moe Cason BBQ Pensacola Eggfest Previous article Give Domestic Violence the boot at Favor House Round Up Next article Saenger Releases 2024 Broadway in Pensacola Lisa Long Lisa Long has cultivated the skill set of combining big-picture thinking + research + insights + storytelling; then integrating it all into the platform of good news.
 

Besides being a Partner with the Local Pulse, she also owns a social media agency.
 

She is passionate about the success of small businesses and the role that they play; and the community impact they have on culture, tourism, and the tax base. 

She lives in Pensacola, Florida with her husband, the Chief Deputy of Escambia County Sheriff’s Office, and their English Cream Golden Retriever named Gracie.  

In the past year two years, she has been recognized and won Community Leader of the Year in 2021 from the Greater Pensacola Chamber of Commerce PACE Awards, EntreCon’s John Myslack Servant Leader of the Year Award in November 2021, and selected as a member of the InWeekly’s Power List 2022 - 2025.

You can find her most days with a cup of coffee, thanking Jesus for her blessings, and being amazed at all the intriguing people she gets to meet.  Odds are, she considers you one of them. Local Pulse News Advertisement News 00:01:19 A Fresh Chapter in Good News & Great Skin with Gulf Coast Plastic Surgery How to Get the Most Out of EntreCon 2025 Ballet Pensacola Presents Dracula Captain Bubba Thorsen and ‘The Chulamar’ 00:00:50 Brave By Nature: Hooves, Horns & Heroes All Business Pensacola Politics & Government Small Business Technology Entertainment Local Pulse’s Weekend Top 10 Ballet Pensacola Presents Dracula Sea, Sip & Savor at Pensacola Beach’s Taste of the Beach Festival Captain Bubba Thorsen and ‘The Chulamar’ 00:00:50 Brave By Nature: Hooves, Horns & Heroes All Festivals Music Television Community Voices Local Pulse’s Weekend Top 10 You Are Worth It Learning to Lead Better by Example Local Pulse Weekend Top 10 We Cannot Live on Bread Alone All Commentary Editorials Satire Lifestyle 00:01:19 A Fresh Chapter in Good News & Great Skin with Gulf Coast Plastic Surgery Local Pulse’s Weekend Top 10 Ballet Pensacola Presents Dracula Sea, Sip & Savor at Pensacola Beach’s Taste of the Beach Festival Captain Bubba Thorsen and ‘The Chulamar’ All Arts & Culture Entertainment Events Faith and Family Family Food Crush Real Estate Health Home Escambia County Meet the Pensacola Eggfest Cook Teams – Round 7 Escambia County Lifestyle Events Features News Pensacola Meet the Pensacola Eggfest Cook Teams – Round 7 By Karen Jolly - October 24, 2024 Ding, Ding, Ding…Round 7. Advertisement I’m beginning to think I should have used a baseball analogy rather than boxing, considering how many rounds I’ve now introduced. So stretch as if it’s the 7th inning stretch then get back into the ring with me to check out our latest contender. The excitement growing, Pensacola. A new venue, new cook teams, new flavors, and new judges (don’t worry some are returning), are all coming together to make this charity event one for the record books. This next cook team is not new to Pensacola Eggfest. In fact, they brought home the 2nd place Judges Award AND the 2nd place People’s Choice Award both years they’ve participated. How’s that for consistency? This year marks their 3rd round and they’re comin’ out swingin’. Meet Team Rocket Five. Rocket Five is the perfect fusion of two different businesses—Rocket Drones and Five Star Custom Flooring—brought together by their shared love for grilling and having a good time with loved ones. Together, they’ve blended Asian, Brazilian, and deep Southern cooking styles to create something truly unique. Pensacola Eggfest is the only BBQ competition they do, because it supports an incredible cause and gives them a chance to hear feedback from the amazing Pensacola community they love. What you don’t know about Team Rocket Five: Their secret ingredient: “At team Rocket Five, the secret ingredient is diversity! With flavors inspired by our team’s roots in Brazil, the Philippines, Texas, and Florida, we bring together spices and grilling techniques that aren’t just traditional backyard BBQ fare. From Brazilian-style picanha to a Filipino twist on pork belly, we’re all about serving up the unexpected. Our secret is to keep things fresh and adventurous—if it’s not making your taste buds dance, it’s not coming off our grill!” If they could only cook with one ingredient: “Hands down, without a doubt, it’s gotta be Brazilian rock salt. There’s something about its simplicity that just speaks to the soul of BBQ. It’s our go-to for everything from a thick, juicy ribeye to a perfectly grilled chicken. For us, rock salt is that happy place where the flavor of the meat shines, and sometimes in life, it’s the simple things that make all the difference!” The most unexpected dish you’ve cooked on the Big Green Egg: “Grilled cheese—literally! We’re not talking about the sandwich, though. We toss blocks of Brazilian queijo coalho straight onto the grill. It’s one of those ‘wait, can you actually do that?’ moments, but when it comes off with that perfect smoky char, it’s a game-changer.” Their best BBQ fail or mishap: “Never let the chimichurri sauce run out!” (Amen to that!) If Team Rocket Five could have one famous person (current or historical) on their cook team it would be: “It’d be Dave Chappelle. His sense of humor would fit right in with our crew, and I can only imagine the hilarious commentary while we’re grilling. Plus, you know he’d keep things laid-back and fun, which is exactly the vibe we love to bring to every BBQ.” The Smack Talk: “Honestly, whoever can keep up with us! We’re bringing the heat, the flavor, and some unexpected twists, so if they can hang, they’re the ones to beat.” Pensacola Eggfest will take place at Noon (or earlier if you snag a VIP ticket which are 95% sold out), Sunday November 10th, 2024, at Hadji Temple, 800 W 9 Mile Rd, Pensacola, FL 32534 .  The event hosts BBQ teams and backyard cooks from all over the United States who share two things: a love of cooking and the joy of giving back to their communities.  Since 2013, over $780,000 has been donated to local charities from this little BBQ party and the Pensacola Eggfest team is ready to push it over the $1 million mark with your help. Come join them to taste all the good food. (Click here for Tickets!) Better yet, grab some friends and join us as a cook team. (Click here to learn more and register your team.) Best of luck, Team Rocket Five! The Pensacola BBQ fans can’t wait to taste what you’re grillin’ up in just a couple of weeks! Peace, Love, and BBQ! Karen Jolly Local Pulse Staff Writer TAGS Barbecue Barbecue Teams BBQ BBQ Champions BBQ competition BBQing Charity Cook Team cooking Events foodie Foodie Events Grilling non-profit pensacola Visit Pensacola Previous article Escambia County Welcomes Sun Belt Basketball Championships Through 2030 Next article EcoKids Brings Art and Education Karen Jolly http://TheRealKstar.com Karen (aka Kstar) was born and raised right here along the Gulf Coast. She's a social media strategist for Red Iron Design and a staff writer for Local Pulse, and self-published Author of The Journey of Love and Letting Go. With a heart for kids and teens, she serves in youth group at Momentum Church and on the board of directors for the Northwest Florida Guardian ad Litem Foundation. Karen enjoys dates with her husband, Doug, anywhere there is delicious food, hanging with her 3 kiddos, GNOs with her besties, having her toes in the beautiful white sand of Pensacola Beach, or floating in her pool with a good book.
